phrases.phrasal_verb:
*Get Back To* \- Contactarse de vuelta/después 📞
\- "Let me check, and I'll get back to you later\." 🕒

Use this when you need time before responding or giving an answer\! Perfect for work and casual conversations\. 😊

*Get At* \- Darse a entender / insinuar 🤔
\- "What are you getting at?" 🕵️‍♂️

Use this when you're trying to understand what someone is implying or suggesting in a conversation\. Perfect for clarifying intentions\! 💬

*Get Up To* \- Tramar algo 🤨
\- "The children are getting up to something\." 🕵️‍♀️

Use this when you suspect someone is secretly planning or doing something mischievous\! Perfect for talking about playful or sneaky behavior\. 😉

*Get On* \- Subir 🚶‍♂️
\- "We need to get on the bus quickly\." 🚌

Use this when referring to boarding a vehicle or moving onto something\.

*Get On* \- Progresar 📈
\- "How are you getting on with your project?" 💼

Use this to ask about someone's progress or advancement\.

*Get On For* \- Llegar a una edad 🎂
\- "She’s getting on for 40\." 🎉

Use this to talk about approaching a certain age\.

*Get Across* \- Ser entendido 🗣️
\- "I hope my message got across\." 📢

Use this when you want to ensure that your message is understood\.

*Get At* \- Dar a entender coloquial 🤔
\- "What are you getting at?" 🕵️‍♂️

Use this to inquire about what someone is implying\.

*Get Down To* \- Ponerse con algo en serio 📚
\- "Let’s get down to business\." 💼

Use this when starting to focus on a task or serious work\.

*Get Off With* \- Evitar un castigo ⚖️
\- "He got off with a warning\." 🚨

Use this when someone avoids punishment\.

*Get Over* \- Sorprenderse 😲
\- "I’m still trying to get over the surprise\." 🎉

Use this when dealing with an unexpected event or shock\.

*Get Over With* \- Terminar algo que no nos gusta 🛑
\- "Let’s get this over with\." 👎

Use this to complete something unpleasant or challenging\.

*Get Round To* \- Encontrar tiempo para hacer algo 🕒
\- "I finally got round to fixing the leak\." 🔧

Use this when you manage to find time to do something\.

*Take In* \- Engañar 🤥
\- "I was taken in by his story\." 😔

Use this when someone deceives or tricks you\.

*Take () Out On* \- Hacer a alguien sufrir por nuestro propio sufrimiento 😠
\- "Don’t take it out on me\." 😡

Use this to describe blaming or mistreating someone due to your own issues\.

*Take Off* \- Imitar 🎭
\- "He does a great impression; he can really take off famous actors\." 👏

Use this when mimicking or impersonating someone\.

*Take On* \- Adquirir una nueva actividad o hábito 🏋️‍♀️
\- "She decided to take on a new hobby\." 🎨

Use this when starting a new activity or habit\.

*Take On* \- Hacer algo extra 💪
\- "He took on extra work to earn more money\." 💼

Use this to refer to taking additional responsibilities\.

*Take Out* \- Firmar un seguro 📝
\- "I need to take out insurance for my new car\." 🚗

Use this when obtaining or signing up for insurance\.

*Take Over* \- Tomar el control 🚀
\- "He will take over the project next month\." 📊

Use this when assuming control or responsibility\.

*Take To Someone* \- Desarrollar apreciación por alguien 💖
\- "I’ve really taken to her since we started working together\." 👫

Use this when developing a liking or affection for someone\.

*Take Away* \- Llevarse 🚶‍♀️
\- "I’ll take away some leftovers for dinner\." 🍲

Use this when removing or taking food from a place\.

*Take Up* \- Ocupar tiempo ⏰
\- "This new job takes up a lot of my time\." ⌛

Use this to describe how something consumes your time\.

*Look Up* \- Buscar una referencia 🔍
\- "I need to look up the definition of this word\." 📚

Use this when searching for information\.

*Look Someone Up* \- Visitar 🏡
\- "I’m going to look up an old friend while I’m in town\." 👋

Use this when visiting someone you know\.

*Look After* \- Cuidar de 🩺
\- "Can you look after my cat while I’m away?" 🐱

Use this when taking care of someone or something\.

*Look Into* \- Investigar 🔬
\- "We need to look into the problem further\." 🔎

Use this when examining or investigating a matter\.

*Look On* \- Considerar 🤔
\- "You should look on this as an opportunity\." 💡

Use this when thinking about or considering something\.

*Go After* \- Perseguir 🏃‍♂️
\- "He’s determined to go after his dreams\." 🌟

Use this when pursuing something or someone\.

*Go Back On* \- Romper una promesa ❌
\- "He went back on his promise\." 🤦‍♂️

Use this when breaking a commitment or promise\.

*Go In For* \- Convertir algo en hábito 🏆
\- "She’s really gone in for yoga lately\." 🧘‍♀️

Use this when adopting or making something a regular habit\.

*Go In For* \- Entrar en una competición 🏅
\- "He decided to go in for the marathon\." 🏃‍♀️

Use this when participating in a competition\.

*Go On* \- Continuar ▶️
\- "The show must go on\." 🎭

Use this to mean continuing or persisting with something\.

*Go Off* \- Estropearse 🚫
\- "The milk has gone off\." 🥴

Use this when something becomes spoiled or unfit for use\.

*Go Off* \- Irse 🏠
\- "She went off to work early\." 🌅

Use this when someone leaves or departs\.

*Go Off* \- Sonar (alarma) ⏰
\- "The alarm went off at midnight\." 🚨

Use this when a device, like an alarm, starts making noise\.

*Go Through* \- Revisar 🔍
\- "We need to go through these documents\." 📑

Use this when examining or reviewing something in detail\.

*Go Through* \- Sufrir 🙁
\- "She’s going through a tough time\." 💔

Use this when someone is experiencing difficulties or hardship\.

*Give In* \- Rendirse 🙅‍♂️
\- "He finally gave in to the pressure\." 🏳️

Use this when yielding or surrendering to something\.

*Give Up* \- Abandonar 🚫
\- "She decided to give up smoking\." 🚬

Use this when quitting or abandoning something\.

*Give Up* \- Rendirse 🏳️‍🌈
\- "Don’t give up on your dreams\." 🌟

Use this when advising against quitting or surrendering\.

*Give Out* \- Distribuir 🎁
\- "They gave out flyers at the event\." 🗞️

Use this when handing out or distributing something\.

*Give Out* \- Dejar de funcionar 🛠️
\- "My car broke down because the engine gave out\." 🚗

Use this when something stops working or fails\.

*Give Off* \- Emitir 🌟
\- "The flowers give off a lovely scent\." 🌹

Use this when something releases or emits something, like a smell or light\.

*Give Over* \- Dejar de hacer algo 🙈
\- "She finally gave over the gossiping\." 🤐

Use this when stopping or ceasing an activity\.

*Give Up On* \- Dejar de creer en alguien o algo 🛑
\- "He gave up on the project\." 📉

Use this when ceasing to have faith or belief in something\.

*Turn Out* \- Resultar ser 🎉
\- "It turned out to be a great party\." 🎈

Use this to describe the outcome or result of something\.

*Turn Down* \- Rechazar ❌
\- "She turned down the job offer\." 🚪

Use this when refusing or declining something\.

*Turn Up* \- Aparecer 🕵️‍♀️
\- "He turned up at the party unexpectedly\." 🎉

Use this when someone or something arrives or appears\.

*Turn Up* \- Aumentar 🔊
\- "Can you turn up the volume?" 🎶

Use this when increasing the intensity or level of something\.

*Turn In* \- Entregar 📨
\- "Please turn in your report by Friday\." 📅

Use this when submitting or handing in something\.

*Turn Into* \- Convertirse en 🔄
\- "The caterpillar turned into a butterfly\." 🦋

Use this when transforming or changing into something different\.

*Turn Over* \- Pasar a alguien más 📂
\- "I need to turn over these responsibilities to a new manager\." 👔

Use this when transferring duties or responsibilities to someone else\.

*Turn Over* \- Girar 🔄
\- "He turned over the page\." 📄

Use this when flipping or rotating something\.

*Set Up* \- Organizar o preparar 🏗️
\- "She set up the meeting room\." 🛋️

Use this when arranging or organizing something\.

*Set Up* \- Crear una empresa 📈
\- "He set up his own business\." 🏢

Use this when establishing or starting a new venture\.

*Settle Down* \- Establecerse 📍
\- "They decided to settle down in the countryside\." 🏡

Use this when choosing a place to live permanently or starting a stable life\.

*Settle Down* \- Calmarse 😌
\- "He needed some time to settle down after the argument\." 🧘‍♂️

Use this when calming down or becoming less agitated\.

*Come Up With* \- Pensar en / Idear 💡
\- "She came up with a brilliant solution\." ✨

Use this when generating ideas or solutions\.

*Come Across* \- Encontrar por casualidad 🔎
\- "I came across an interesting article\." 📖

Use this when discovering something unexpectedly\.

*Come Down With* \- Enfermarse 🤒
\- "He came down with a cold\." 🤧

Use this when starting to suffer from an illness\.

*Come Over* \- Visitar 🏠
\- "Why don’t you come over for coffee?" ☕

Use this when inviting someone to visit your place\.

*Come Up* \- Surgir 💭
\- "A problem came up during the meeting\." 🚩

Use this when something arises or occurs unexpectedly\.

*Come Up With* \- Idear algo 💡
\- "She came up with a great idea for the project\." ✨

Use this when developing or creating something new\.

*Put Up With* \- Tolerar 😣
\- "I can’t put up with the noise any longer\." 🚫

Use this when enduring or tolerating something unpleasant\.

*Put Off* \- Posponer ⏳
\- "Let’s put off the meeting until next week\." 📅

Use this when delaying or rescheduling something\.

*Put On* \- Ponerse ropa 👗
\- "She put on her coat and left\." 🧥

Use this when dressing in clothes\.

*Put Out* \- Apagar 🔥
\- "He put out the fire with a blanket\." 🔥

Use this when extinguishing a fire or light\.

*Put Up* \- Levantar algo 🛠️
\- "He put up a shelf in the living room\." 🏠

Use this when installing or mounting something\.

*Put Up* \- Alojarse 🏨
\- "They put us up in a nice hotel\." 🛏️

Use this when providing accommodation for someone\.

*Make Up* \- Inventar algo 🤥
\- "She made up a story to explain her absence\." 📖

Use this when creating or fabricating something\.

*Make Up For* \- Compensar ⚖️
\- "He bought her a gift to make up for being late\." 🎁

Use this when compensating or making amends for something\.

*Make Out* \- Distinguir o entender 🤔
\- "I could barely make out the words\." 🔍

Use this when perceiving or understanding something with difficulty\.

*Make Up* \- Reconciliarse ❤️
\- "They made up after their argument\." 🤝

Use this when resolving a dispute and reconciling\.

*Break Down* \- Romperse 🚗
\- "The car broke down on the way to work\." 🚙

Use this when a vehicle or machine stops working\.

*Break Into* \- Entrar por la fuerza 🚪
\- "The burglars broke into the house last night\." 🏚️

Use this when entering a place unlawfully\.

*Break Up* \- Romper una relación 💔
\- "They decided to break up after three years\." 🥀

Use this when ending a romantic relationship\.

*Break Out* \- Escapar 🚨
\- "The prisoners managed to break out of jail\." 🚔

Use this when escaping from a place\.

*Break Through* \- Superar obstáculos 🚀
\- "She broke through the barrier to achieve her goals\." 🌟

Use this when overcoming obstacles or challenges\.

*Break Down* \- Analizar 🤓
\- "Let’s break down the process into smaller steps\." 📋

Use this when analyzing or dividing something into parts\.

*Take Over* \- Tomar control 🕹️
\- "He will take over the project from here\." 🎯

Use this when assuming control or responsibility\.

*Take Up* \- Comenzar una actividad 🏃
\- "She took up jogging to stay fit\." 🏋️‍♀️

Use this when starting a new hobby or activity\.

*Take After* \- Parecerse a 🧬
\- "He takes after his father in looks\." 👨‍👦

Use this when resembling or inheriting traits from someone\.

*Take Out* \- Sacar algo 🚮
\- "Don’t forget to take out the trash\." 🗑️

Use this when removing or disposing of something\.

*Take Down* \- Desmontar 🛠️
\- "They took down the decorations after the party\." 🎉

Use this when removing or disassembling something\.

*Run Out Of* \- Quedarse sin 🏁
\- "We ran out of milk\." 🥛

Use this when depleting or exhausting a supply\.

*Run Into* \- Encontrarse con 🚶
\- "I ran into an old friend at the mall\." 🛍️

Use this when meeting someone unexpectedly\.

*Run Away* \- Huir 🏃‍♂️
\- "The cat ran away when it saw the dog\." 🐱

Use this when escaping or fleeing from a situation\.

*Run Across* \- Encontrar por casualidad 💫
\- "I ran across a great book in the library\." 📚

Use this when discovering something unexpectedly\.

*Get By* \- Arreglárselas 💪
\- "They get by on a small income\." 💵

Use this when managing or coping with limited resources\.

*Get Out Of* \- Evitar hacer algo 🚫
\- "He tried to get out of doing his chores\." 🧹

Use this when avoiding or escaping a responsibility\.

*Get Over* \- Superar algo 😌
\- "She finally got over her fear of flying\." ✈️

Use this when recovering from something difficult or overcoming an obstacle\.

*Get Along* \- Llevarse bien 👥
\- "They get along very well\." 🤝

Use this when having a harmonious relationship with someone\.

*Get Back* \- Regresar 🏡
\- "She needs to get back to work\." 🏢

Use this when returning to a previous place or state\.

*Get Around* \- Moverse / Viajar 🌍
\- "He gets around the city by bike\." 🚴‍♂️

Use this when traveling or navigating in a place\.

*Get In* \- Entrar 🚪
\- "They couldn’t get in because the door was locked\." 🔑

Use this when entering a place or being accepted into a group\.

*Get Off* \- Bajar de 🚏
\- "We need to get off at the next stop\." 🚌

Use this when leaving a mode of transportation\.

*Get On* \- Subir a 🚋
\- "She got on the train at the station\." 🚆

Use this when boarding a mode of transportation\.

*Get Through* \- Superar algo 💪
\- "They got through the difficult times\." 🌟

Use this when overcoming a challenge or difficulty\.

*Get Ahead* \- Avanzar 🚀
\- "She’s trying to get ahead in her career\." 🌟

Use this when making progress or advancing in something\.

*Get Off With* \- Salir libre de algo 😅
\- "He got off with a warning\." 🚨

Use this when avoiding a more severe consequence or punishment\.

*Get Together* \- Reunirse 🤝
\- "They decided to get together for a dinner\." 🍽️

Use this when meeting with others socially\.

*Get By* \- Sobrevivir / Arreglárselas 🚶
\- "We manage to get by with what we have\." 💪

Use this when surviving or managing with limited resources\.

*Get Out* \- Salir / Escapar 🏃
\- "I need to get out of the house more often\." 🏠

Use this when leaving or escaping a place or situation\.

*Take After* \- Parecerse a alguien 👨‍👦
\- "She takes after her mother in personality\." 💁‍♀️

Use this when resembling someone in traits or appearance\.

*Take Up* \- Comenzar a hacer algo 📚
\- "He took up painting as a hobby\." 🎨

Use this when starting a new activity or interest\.

*Take On* \- Asumir responsabilidades 💼
\- "She took on the role of team leader\." 🧑‍💼

Use this when accepting or assuming a role or responsibility\.

*Take Out* \- Sacar algo del lugar 🚮
\- "He took out the garbage\." 🗑️

Use this when removing or disposing of something from a place\.

*Break Up* \- Terminar una relación 💔
\- "They decided to break up after a long time together\." 😢

Use this when ending a romantic relationship\.

*Break Down* \- Descomponerse 🚗
\- "My car broke down on the highway\." 🚧

Use this when a vehicle stops working or breaks\.

*Break In* \- Forzar la entrada 🚪
\- "They broke in through the back door\." 🚪

Use this when entering a place by force or illegally\.

*Break Through* \- Superar barreras 🌟
\- "She broke through the challenges to succeed\." 🎯

Use this when overcoming obstacles or barriers\.

*Break Into* \- Introducirse por la fuerza 🚪
\- "He broke into the business market\." 📈

Use this when entering a market or area by force or with difficulty\.

*Come Across* \- Encontrarse con algo por casualidad 💫
\- "I came across an old friend at the store\." 🛒

Use this when meeting or finding something unexpectedly\.

*Come Down* \- Reducirse ⬇️
\- "Prices came down after the sale\." 💲

Use this when decreasing or reducing in quantity or value\.

*Come Up* \- Surgir / Aparecer 🌟
\- "A new opportunity came up\." 🆕

Use this when something arises or becomes available\.

*Come Over* \- Visitar / Pasar por casa 🏠
\- "They came over for a barbecue\." 🍔

Use this when visiting or spending time at someone's home\.

*Come Out* \- Salir / Publicar 📚
\- "The new book is coming out next week\." 📖

Use this when something is released or becomes available to the public\.

*Put Off* \- Retrasar ⏳
\- "They had to put off their vacation plans\." 🏖️

Use this when delaying or postponing something\.

*Put Up With* \- Soportar 😣
\- "I can’t put up with the noise any longer\." 🚫

Use this when enduring or tolerating something\.

*Put Out* \- Apagar 🔥
\- "He put out the fire with a blanket\." 🔥

Use this when extinguishing a fire or light\.

*Put Up* \- Levantar / Instalar 🛠️
\- "They put up the decorations for the party\." 🎉

Use this when setting up or installing something\.

*Get Along* \- Llevarse bien 🤝
\- "They get along very well\." 😊

Use this when having a friendly or harmonious relationship with someone\.

*Get Back* \- Regresar 🏡
\- "She needs to get back to work\." 💼

Use this when returning to a previous place or task\.

*Get By* \- Sobrevivir / Arreglárselas 🌍
\- "They get by with what they have\." 💪

Use this when managing or coping with limited resources\.

*Get Over* \- Superar algo 😌
\- "He finally got over his fear of heights\." 🌄

Use this when recovering from or overcoming something challenging\.
